sentence.text: Hyperpolarization-activated cyclic nucleotide-gated channels (HCN) can act as pacemakers in the brain making them strong candidates for driving aberrant hypersynchronous network activity seen in epilepsy.
However, only recently have genetic studies demonstrated sequence variation in HCN1 and HCN2 genes associated with human epilepsy.
These include a triple proline deletion in HCN2 that increases channel function and occurs more often in patients with febrile seizure syndromes.
